intro.text: You are standing outside a cornfield. It is windy and looks like it might rain.
The field continues on. To the north there is a mountain that looms large and menacing.
You climb the mountain. It is super arduous. You are sweaty and can go no further. To the west there is a path.
You come across a wide boulevard cutting through the mountain.

You and the Jesus walk up the steep, windy path toward the dwelling-place of the Monks of Eternal Anguish. Jesus carries you for part of the way, and makes a bigger deal out of it than you think socially appropriate.
You arrive at the monastery, which is a humble abode built in the German Brutalist style.
You enter the main meditation hall of the Monastery. It has high ceilings depicting scenes of pure anguish.

sceneList.name: Bathroom

intro.text: You step into a room coated in a thick layer of books and dust. This looks like the monastery library. It also looks like the monks don't read very much.

The world is an oblate spheroid ringed with clouds, dragons, and other winged satellites. It is a dark time in which people have lost their way in the world. The Son of God has returned to earth to chew bubblegum and finish what he started. And he's almost out of bubblegum.

parts.name: Part II: In which The Jesus unleashes eternal anguish on the world

intro.text: You and Jesus run far, fast and far. You don't know how far. But far enough that you're pretty worn out and about ready to sit.

actions.name: close

inSceneDescription.text: There is a bowl of wool here.

description.text: A bowl of wool

actions.name: look at
take
actions.script:
singlePlay("You camp out in the field for three nights. You and the sheep form a lasting bond. You decide you want to follow this sheep everywhere. Or maybe it wants to follow you. It's unclear. Whatever, you're together now.")
addItemToInventory("Sheep")

inSceneDescription.text: There is a sheep here. It looks like a baaaaaaad one.

description.text: There are fewer sheep than there are ferrets. You think this one would follow you.

response.text:
"Man, no one get's what I was trying to teach. I want to start a new religion that get's shit right. Want to help?"

"How can I help?" You ask

"You need to go on a quest, a Jesus Quest™. First youll need to ride high into the mountains, and obtain some sweet sweet kush. Then, bring me 150 duck bladder's. Preferably full. It'll be difficult. Then seek the Ultimate Knowledge © 2017, known only by the Monks of Eternal Anguish®. They just spend all day meditating about how morose they are. Their not a fun bunch. Bring them the sweet kush." Says the Jesus.

"Ok then." You reply.
"Get going! Bring me those bladders and that sweet sweet kush!"
"Oh, these? I'm a ferretomancer. I control elemental ferrets. I've got lot's! Want one?"

inSceneDescription.text: There is a Jesus standing in the field.

description.text: The Jesus is wearing a plain robe made of mustard. He has an aggressive beard and many ferrets.

inSceneDescription.text: The Jesus is surrounded by ferrets that gambol about the area and snatch at his sleeves.

description.text: This seems like too many ferrets.

actions.name: use
actions.script:
singlePlay("The ferret leaps out of your pants!", "")
singlePlay("He gets bored and jumps back in.", "")

actions.name: take
actions.script:
singlePlay("The ferret leaps into your pants. It's oddly comfortable", "")
addItemToInventory('ferret')
removeItemFromScene('ferret', 'a field')
once()

description.text: One ferret seems particularly taken with you.

actions.name: give
give
actions.script: play("\"No man, that harshes my anguish!\"", '')

actions.name: give
actions.script: play("\"My tea suits me just fine, thank you!\"", '')

actions.name: give
actions.script: play("\"Nah, I cannot reconcile that sweet sweet kush with the vast unending pain of existence.\"", '')

inSceneDescription.text: You see the sweet sweet kush of which the Jesus spoke!

description.text: It is as foretold in the prophecy of 15 minutes ago!

inSceneDescription.text: Down this road marches a parade of ducks. It stretches endlessly in both directions. "WTF," you think.

description.text: The ducks march twenty abreast, not turning their heads to look at you. They seem very grim.

actions.name: give
actions.script:
singlePlay("\"WHAT? Dude, I was just joking about the duck bladders. Where did you get all of these? And what are these? Ducks don't HAVE bladders! \nWhat did you do?! And wait, where's Billy, last I saw he jumped int your pants! WHAT DID YOU DO TO BILLY????\" He angry, the Jesus", "")
setFlag('The Jesus', 'mad')

inSceneDescription.text: Among other entrails and offal you spy some duck bladders.

description.text: This is super gross. Most of them are full.

actions.name: use
actions.script:
singlePlay(`You knock on the door which booms loudly with each strike. From the other side you hear the small voice of a man. He seems quite anguished.`)
addItemToScene('man', 'The Monastery Entrance')

actions.name: open
actions.script: play("It's locked.", '')

inSceneDescription.text: A large (ADA compliant) door blocks your way.

description.text: It is quite a large door with intricate woodwork. It shows massive number of dwarves in anguish cowering in the fetal position before a demon named Yghardmaorgipf. You don't know how you know that.

response.text: Yes, it's quite a nice door, isn't it? Cost five thousand rubles. Now go away! Can't you see I'm anguished?
Yes, we have it. Now go away!

topics.name: anguish
topics.script:
console.log("Asked about anguish")
play(
    `"I hear you're eternally anguished," you say. "That's right," the monk replies. "And we don't want any happy people from outside disturbing our misery!" "But," you reply, "I too am miserable! Just a few moments ago I lost a dear friend to a horde of ducks!" You tell the monk the sad tale of Billy the Ferret, how he used to ride in your pants, and how he met his untimely demise, so young. Your eyes fill with tears, and it seems the monk is also crying. You hear soft sobs emanating from behind the door. There is some silence. Then a voice says, "We see that you are one of us. Enter, brother."`,
    '')
switchScene('inside the monastery')

inSceneDescription.text: There is a man on the other side of the door.
Surrounding the courtyard are many statues of people being tortured.

description.text: This one looks disturbingly like you.

response.text: "Ach, talk to Mortimor. That's his job."

topics.name: man on rack

greeting.text: Hello my son, what can I hurt you for?

inSceneDescription.text: In the center of the courtyard sits an elderly man wearing a loincloth and a crown of thorns and drinking tea.

description.text: He's clearly in charge here.
The teabag label says "Cloud of Despair".

response.text: "Go talk to Mortimor about that. He handles all such... tasks..."

actions.name: push

inSceneDescription.text: Lurking behind a column you see a surprisingly well dressed man whose face is entirely covered in white corpsepaint and guyliner. He grimaces unconvincingly at you.

description.text: He looks like Iggy Pop, in fact, you're almost positive it is. He seems like kind of a pushover.

response.text: "We three monks are the keepers of Ultimate Knowledge © 2017. Only the truely anguished can even begin to comprehend it. I'm afraid your fragile mind couldn't handle it. Sartorious got drunk once and gave it to a shepherd. He died instantaniously. Or, passed out. We didn't stick around to find out."

topics.name: clogged toilet
topics.script:
play('"Egads! I just unclogged that dang thing last week." Mortimer slouches off to the bathroom, grumbling all the way.')

removeItemFromScene('Mortimor', 'Inside the Monastery')
addItemToScene('Mortimor', 'Bathroom')
changeInSceneDescription('Mortimor', {text: 'Mortimor is poking around in the clogged toilet with a stick.', audio: ''})
makeUnbroachable("Mortimor", "clogged toilet")

response.text: I'm Mortimor. That's Steve sitting over there with the tea and the crown of thorns. Sartorius is the one who dresses in all black and acts spooky all the time.

inSceneDescription.text: Beside the door is a small man in woollen clothes. They look ichy.

description.text: He's bald in that classic Christian monk sort of way, but you suspect it wasn't voluntary.

actions.name: close
open

inSceneDescription.text: There is a medicine cabinet on one wall.

description.text: I wonder what's in here?

actions.name: use
actions.script: play("I'm feeling fine, thank you.")

inSceneDescription.text: Laxative sits on the shelf.

description.text: "Xaksaphraxaþhil™: makes the poops come out!" Seems like pretty strong stuff...

inSceneDescription.text: An empty roll lies on the floor beneth the toilet.

description.text: The human condition, summed up in five inches of cardboard. Eloquent.

actions.name: use
actions.script: play("You don't have to go right now.", "")

inSceneDescription.text: Two toilets sit in unoccupied stalls. Neither has toilet paper. These monks must truely be in anguish.

description.text: It's porcelain. Beautiful porcelain
It looks so comfy.
You've never seen such an attractive toilet.
Such beauty shouldn't exist in such a wicked world. You're overcome with a desire to destroy it.

actions.name: close

inSceneDescription.text: High up on one wall is a small window which admits a feeble breeze.

description.text: It's a place where there's no wall. There's glass though. See-through glass.

actions.name: use
actions.script: play("I have enough holes in my ass", "")

inSceneDescription.text: On the floor there are spiky meditation mats. They don't look very comfortable.

description.text: The mats are covered in one inch long spikes. The tips are red with blood. That can't be sanitary.

inSceneDescription.text: On one side of the room, there is a man stretched across a torture rack, screaming in anguish.

description.text: There's a lever for adjusting the tension. He already looks pretty tense.

inSceneDescription.text: On the other side of the room is a man stubbing his toe.

description.text: He seems to be in the most anguish.

inSceneDescription.text: In the middle of the room is a Scotsman on a horse.

description.text: A Scotsman on a horse!

actions.name: push
actions.script:
play("The man's screams subside. He passes out.", '')
setFlag('Man on rack', 'notScreaming')
makeBroachable('Steve', 'man on rack')

actions.name: pull
actions.script: play("The man screams louder. Maybe you should try pushing instead.", '')

description.text: This lever controls the rack.
There's a lever for adjusting the tension. This guy already looks pretty tense.

inSceneDescription.text: There are a lot of books.

description.text: There's one that catches your eye. "A brief history of monks getting high." It looks very brief indeed.

items.name: Book

actions.name: use
actions.script: play("You open the book to the first page, and read: \"In 1332 the monks of York got high.\" All the other pages are blank.")

aliases: a brief history of monks getting high

description.text: It's a pretty nice hardbound book. The cover is made out of mustard.

actions.name: give

inSceneDescription.text: On the desk is a metal thurible full of incense.

description.text: Smelly, but in a good way.

inSceneDescription.text: A large wooden desk sits against the far wall.

description.text: It's large, and wooden!

actions.name: give

nothing to talk about.text: You have nothing to talk about

help.text:
The commands are look, look at, take, use, open, close, push, pull, give, go, ask, talk to/goodbye, and list

 There are also natural language commands such as 'play piano'

combinations.script:
singlePlay("The ferret leaps out of your pants and attacks the mass of ducks. It's a blood bath. Feathers fly everywhere. You estimate the ferret takes down 147 ducks before succumbing to the duck billed fury. You will miss him dearly. Your pants will never feel full again", "")
removeItemFromInventory('ferret')
addItemToScene("duck bladders", "The Parade of Ducks")
removeItemFromScene("ducks", "The Parade of Ducks")
